instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.message:
PPBUS is 12.58V but goes to 12.50 for 10 seg and then to 12.33V for 1 seg. and back to 12.58V
3.3V S5 stable
5V and other rails pulsing each 7 seg.
ISL and SMC area look clean and no liquide damage. SCL and SDA at 3.42V

What is first? SMC, ISL or something else?
Check other rails for power cycling too. Possible short on a rail, check.

I compared other rails (in big coils) with another board and have same value in diode mode. CPUcore cycling too.
Customer goes to Apple store to replace the screen and also said that mouse is chaotic and 3 days laters working with the Macbook, it turn off.

I compared too <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>-<CHIP>U8080</CHIP> all power mosfet and same value in diode mode.
If I remove <RESISTOR>R8167</RESISTOR> all rails appears stable except CPU core.
History? Screen cracked because dropped? Liquid?

No dropped, no liquide. Just turn off during the customer uses.
As I said before, 
If I remove <RESISTOR>R8167</RESISTOR> all rails appears stable except CPU core. What that means?

Why did they go to Apple to get the screen replaced? 
Problem could be anything. If really "just" happened BIOS could be a good suspect.
